wikipedia_page.main: Ebenezer Henderson (25 February 1809 – 2 November 1879) was a Scottish historian and science writer. His major work was The Annals of Dunfermline.

response: Ebenezer Henderson (1784–1858), a minister and missionary, was born at the Linn near Dunfermline. His nephew Ebenezer Henderson (1809–1879), a science writer and historian born in Dunfermline, wrote The Annals of Dunfermline.
Ebenezer Henderson (17 November 178417 May 1858) was a Scottish minister and missionary. He spent the early part of his life in Scandinavia, was an accomplished linguist and translator.
*Memoirs of Ebenezer Henderson, by Thulia S Henderson (his daughter) (London, 1859)
* Ebenezer Henderson (1784–1858), Scottish minister and missionary
* Ebenezer Henderson (writer) (1809–1879), Scottish historian and science writer
